p: BenMAP is an open-source, PC-based tool that was designed to quantify the number and economic value of air pollution-related premature deaths and illnesses. The U.S. EPA, in collaboration with software developers from throughout the world, developed the tool to routinize and standardize the process for estimating these impactsâ€”thus supporting air quality policies with credible estimates of the health impacts of poor air quality [ 37].
